body.p: The purpose of modulelists is to introduce a shorthand form for homogen modules. The module lists are transformed to modules before the modulestructure is set up. The script may contain any number of modulelists. A module list must be contained in a module.

Note that modulelists introduce some limitations on remotecollections, see . It also takes over control of the sequence of modules. You should consider modulelists only in special cases where you want a large number of homogen modules for special purposes, like producing modules for a set of products, a calendar, a team of people.

tr.td: Any string that represents a catalog, absolute or relative to the scripts catalog. Contentfiles are supposed to be in this catalog, and prepared modules will be placed in this catalog.
Identification of a template by id. If template is ommitted, the source file is considered template (with no content-file)
Suffix of actual content-files. Default is xml
Suffix of resulting modules. Default is html.
A commaseparted string of books that these modules should be a part of. Default value is _all.
